instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light, no pp3v42
threads.message:
Hi there! i feel silly for posting this but i'm a little rusty it seems. This should be a fairly basic issue but here we are
No green light, no PP3v42, no short on PP3v42. I know Pp3v42 is required to enable green light, so the main DC in connection must be the issue? there was liquid damge around ISL6259 and a little in some random spots/ Have replaced ISL and U5110. obviously tested with known working DC board and cable but no change

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light, no pp3v42
threads.message:
May have an input leakage issue; did you test with fake charger, or lab PSU?
Did you check diode mode to ground at PPBUS/3V42_G3H?
DCIN_G3H is there?

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light, no pp3v42
threads.message:
My Lab PSU is currently waiting for a fuse since i blew it up so I can't right now :( 

PPBUS diode to ground is 0.712

Pp3v42 diode is 0.3

DCIN_G3H is only 1.7V, that's too low right?
DCIN_G3H diode is 0.13

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light, no pp3v42
threads.message:
As I suspected, leakage input problem.
Original charger detects it and gets blocked.

Check R/D7012 first; if both good, change Q7180.

"PPBUS diode to ground is 0.712"
Not sure how did you test it; should be 0.120-0.160 aprox...
